name: Hadamard Test
description: Estimate Re(⟨ψ|U|ψ⟩) for U=Z gate and |ψ⟩=|+⟩ using a single ancilla qubit.
long_description: The Hadamard test estimates the real part of the expectation value ⟨ψ|U|ψ⟩ using one ancilla qubit. The ancilla is placed in superposition, a controlled-U is applied, and a final Hadamard on the ancilla transforms the relative phase into a probability difference. For U=Z and |ψ⟩=|+⟩, Re(⟨+|Z|+⟩) = 0, so both outcomes are equally likely. The imaginary part uses an S† gate.

references.title: Aharonov et al. (2009). A Polynomial Quantum Algorithm for Approximating the Jones Polynomial. Algorithmica 55(3)

author: OpenQC Community
